p: Lucky nut has bloomed as biomass source of derivative for alternative diesel manufacture. The tree is an evergreen tropical shrub with needle like leaves usually greenish in colour ( Fig.Â 1). Usually surrounded by waxy coating to minimize dehydration, with it stem usually changed in colour as it grow older. The seed mainly called lucky nut seeds contain high percentage oil, ranging from 33.0 to 77. 62% (v/v) which are used for biofuel production [ 4, 5].
